oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews on Collie's Corner - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Mac Wiseman (performer), Sue Thompson (performer), Claude King (performer), and Stonewall Jackson (performer), conducted by Biff Collie for Collie's Corner.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie introduces Mac Wiseman -- Wiseman talks about playing bluegrass and talks about doing A&R work for Dot Records -- Wiseman talks about producing for other artists -- Wiseman talks about where he was born and raised, in the Blue Ridge Mountains -- Wiseman talks about majoring in radio in college -- Wiseman talks about starting out playing the mandolin, then guitar, and then banjo -- Wiseman talks about playing with Flatt & Scruggs and working on the Grand Ole Opry -- Wiseman talks about genre labeling, especially in bluegrass music -- Wiseman talks about the transition of bluegrass music into modern music -- Wiseman talks about bluegrass music one of the original American art forms -- Wiseman talks about audience playing a big role in genre -- Wiseman talks about his favorite kind of songs to play and his favorite venues -- Biff Collie concludes the interview -- Biff Collie introduces Sue Thompson -- Thompson talks about wanting to be a singer ever since she was a child -- Thompson talks about how grateful she is for her success -- Biff Collie concludes the interview -- Biff Collie introduces Claude King -- King talks about some of his recent success -- King talks about his manager Tillman Franks -- King talks about taking a break from making music then coming back -- King talks about working with Dick Clark and playing a show with over 125,000 audience members with Bobby Bare, Bruce Chanel, Johnny Crawford and more -- King talks about working with Homer and Jethro, and how they are funnier off stage than on stage -- King talks about getting encores at shows and Homer and Jethro would run out and steal his encore -- Biff Collie talks about recording with King -- Biff Collie concludes the interview -- Biff Collie introduces Stonewall Jackson, backstage at the Grand Ole Opry -- Jackson talks about how he got into country music -- Jackson talks about living in Brentwood, Tennessee near other country artists -- Jackson talks about his own favorite recordings -- Biff Collie concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Wiseman, Mac; Thompson, Sue, 1925-; King, Claude, 1923-2013; Jackson, Stonewall (musician);
